name: DeLorean Time Machine
description: A modified DeLorean sports car capable of time travel, designed and built by Doc Brown.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The **DeLorean Time Machine** is a central piece of technology in the *Back to the Future* trilogy. It is a DeLorean sports car modified by Doc Brown to travel through time, making it an iconic symbol of the series.

content.title: Design
content.body: The vehicle is primarily a **DeLorean DMC-12**, chosen for its distinctive gull-wing doors and futuristic look. It is fitted with a **Flux Capacitor**, which is described as "what makes time travel possible." Additional features include glowing lights, custom instrumentation, and a digital display for inputting the desired time destination.

content.title: Capabilities
content.body: The DeLorean Time Machine is capable of traveling to any date in history, past or future. It requires reaching a speed of **88 miles per hour** and initially needed **plutonium** to generate the 1.21 gigawatts of electricity required. In later modifications, it uses a **Mr. Fusion Home Energy Reactor** capable of using household waste to generate the necessary energy.

content.title: History
content.body: Built by **Doc Brown** in 1985, the car was first tested in the Twin Pines Mall parking lot. It plays a pivotal role in the story as it allows the main characters to alter historical events. The DeLorean experiences multiple upgrades and extensive use across several lost and restored timelines throughout the series.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: From the moment it transports Marty McFly to the year **1955**, the DeLorean Time Machine becomes central to the narrative. It is the catalyst for Marty's adventures through time, including trips to 2015 and an alternate 1985, as well as back to 1885 in the Old West. The vehicle's presence in key scenes accentuates the tension, drama, and humor of the trilogy.
